metadata.title: DevFest Ogbomoso
metadata.description: DevFest Ogbomoso is a community-run, developer event that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon, and more.

throwback.title: Throwback to DevFest '23: Vibes and Tech All the Way
throwback.subtitle: Remember the energy? The pictures, the jollof, the pure tech vibes? Last year, we turned up and showed out. From inspiring sessions to unforgettable connections, DevFest 2023 was everything and more.

speakers.name: Adeola Adegoke
speakers.title: From Concept to Prototype: Rapid Prototyping
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Adeola is a Product Designer with over three years of professional experience, using creativity and technology to deliver impactful user-centric digital products. She is a graduate of Ladoke Akintola University of Technology with a degree in Marketing

speakers.name: Courage Egbude
speakers.title: Design Systems: A Unified Language Between Designers and Developers
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Courage Egbude is a Product Designer with over four years of experience. With a background in engineering and a deep passion for leveraging technology to solve complex problems, Courage has designed ipactful user experiences for various industries.

speakers.name: Daniel Jermaine
speakers.title: Authentication Strategies in iOS with Firebase
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Daniel Jermaine is an experienced iOS software developer with six years of expertise in creating innovative applications. He believes in sharing knowledge and empowering the tech community through both his work and mentorship.

speakers.name: Joel Olawanle
speakers.title: How giving back in tech unlocks new opportunities
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Joel Olawanle is a software engineer and technical writer passionate about building innovative products ans writing on technical topics. He is the Chapter Lead for OSCA Ibadan, where he is organizing both in-person and virtual open-source events.

speakers.name: Joy Ajiboye
speakers.title: Productivity Hacks for Developers: Tools, Techniques and Mindset for Maximum Performance
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Joy Ajiboye is a dedicated Software Engineer specializing in Frontend Development, with a passion for creating digital experiences that are visually appealing and user-friendly.

speakers.name: Obumuneme Nwabude
speakers.title: How to use Google AI for A/B Testing
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Obum is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) in the DArt and Flutter category. He is also a full-stack Blockchain and Web developer with professional frontend, backend and web3 experiences. He has written several articles on Flutter in various publications and volunteers in tech communities

speakers.name: Opeyimika Aremu
speakers.title: From Scrubs to Scripts: Mastering Tech Skills When Life Happens
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: OPeyimika Aremu is a full-time medical student and a front-end Engineer. When he is not writing code or reading school work for an upcoming test or exam, he's at the gym or eating while reading the latest Zikoko articles.

speakers.name: Paul Edward
speakers.title: From Startup to Scale-up - System Design for Everyone
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Paul Edward is a Senior Software Developer with over twelve years of experience. With having a Diploma in Computer Science, a certified pen tester,  he has developed software with high standars and interacted with multiple stakeholders from technical and non-technical backgrounds, ensuring clarity, quality asn continuous delivery.

speakers.name: Daniel Jermaine
speakers.title: Authentication Strategies in iOS with Firebase
speakers.description: This session will focus on the nuances of writing for developers, including tips on simplifying complex concepts, structuring technical tutorials, and using code snippets effectively.
speakers.bio: Daniel Jermaine is an experienced iOS software developer with six years of expertise in creating innovative applications. He believes in sharing knowledge and empowering the tech community through both his work and mentorship.

speakerSection.title: Meet the DevFest Ogbomoso 2024 Speakers
speakerSection.subtitle: We've raised the bar this year with our impressive lineup of speakers, each prepared to share valuable insights on different aspects of the tech community.

schedule.title: Options For Everyone
schedule.subtitle: At DevFest Ogbomoso 2024, we're serving up a full menu of talks and sessions to match every taste. No matter what you're into, there's something for you.

community.title: GDG Ogbomoso
community.subtitle: A community-led tech conference bringing together developers, designers, and tech enthusiasts.

faqs.question: What is DevFest Ogbomoso?
faqs.answer: DevFest Ogbomoso is a community-led developer conference focused on community building and learning about Google's technologies.

faqs.question: When and where is it happening?
faqs.answer: DevFest Ogbomoso 2024 will take place on November 15-16, 2024, at the Landmark Event Center, Ogbomoso.

faqs.question: Who can attend?
faqs.answer: DevFest is open to anyone interested in technology, from students to professional developers, designers, and tech enthusiasts.

faqs.question: What should I bring?
faqs.answer: Bring your laptop, charger, and an open mind ready to learn and connect with fellow developers!
